verses.text: Then we turned , and took our journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea , as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto me: and we compassed mount Seir many days.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto me, saying ,
Ye have compassed this mountain long enough : turn you northward.

And command thou the people , saying , Ye \add are\add* to pass through the coast of your brethren the children of Esau , which dwell in Seir ; and they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore:

Meddle not with them; for I will not give you of their land , no, not so much as a foot breadth ; because I have given mount Seir unto Esau \add for\add* a possession.\f + \fr 2.5 \ft no…: Heb. even to the treading of the sole of the foot\f*
Ye shall buy meat of them for money , that ye may eat ; and ye shall also buy water of them for money , that ye may drink.

For the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God hath blessed thee in all the works of thy hand : he knoweth thy walking through this great wilderness : these forty years the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God \add hath been\add* with thee; thou hast lacked nothing. \p

And when we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau , which dwelt in Seir , through the way of the plain from Elath , and from Ezion-gaber , we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto me, Distress not the Moabites , neither contend with them in battle : for I will not give thee of their land \add for\add* a possession ; because I have given Ar unto the children of Lot \add for\add* a possession.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft Distress…: or, Use no hostility against Moab\f*
The Emims dwelt therein in times past , a people great , and many , and tall , as the Anakims ;
Which also were accounted giants , as the Anakims ; but the Moabites call them Emims.

The Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime ; but the children of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession , which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* gave unto them.\f + \fr 2.12 \ft succeeded: Heb. inherited\f*\f + \fr 2.12 \ft stead: or, room\f*
Now rise up , \add said I\add*, and get you over the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.\f + \fr 2.13 \ft brook: or, valley\f*

And the space in which we came from Kadesh-barnea , until we were come over the brook Zered , \add was\add* thirty and eight years ; until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host , as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sware unto them.\f + \fr 2.14 \ft brook: or, valley\f*
For indeed the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was against them, to destroy them from among the host , until they were consumed. \p
¶ So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people ,
That the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto me, saying ,
Thou art to pass over through Ar , the coast of Moab , this day :

And \add when\add* thou comest nigh over against the children of Ammon , distress them not, nor meddle with them: for I will not give thee of the land of the children of Ammon \add any\add* possession ; because I have given it unto the children of Lot \add for\add* a possession.
(That also was accounted a land of giants : giants dwelt therein in old time ; and the Ammonites call them Zamzummims ;\f + \fr 2.20 \ft Zamzummims: also called, Zuzims\f*
A people great , and many , and tall , as the Anakims ; but the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead:
As he did to the children of Esau , which dwelt in Seir , when he destroyed the Horims from before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day :
And the Avims which dwelt in Hazerim , \add even\add* unto Azzah , the Caphtorims , which came forth out of Caphtor , destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.) \p

¶ Rise ye up , take your journey , and pass over the river Arnon : behold , I have given into thine hand Sihon the Amorite , king of Heshbon , and his land : begin to possess \add it\add*, and contend with him in battle.\f + \fr 2.24 \ft begin…: Heb. begin, possess\f*

This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations \add that are\add* under the whole heaven , who shall hear report of thee, and shall tremble , and be in anguish because of thee. \p
¶ And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace , saying ,
Let me pass through thy land : I will go along by the high way , I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
Thou shalt sell me meat for money , that I may eat ; and give me water for money , that I may drink : only I will pass through on my feet ;

(As the children of Esau which dwell in Seir , and the Moabites which dwell in Ar , did unto me;) until I shall pass over Jordan into the land which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God giveth us.

But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God hardened his spirit , and made his heart obstinate , that he might deliver him into thy hand , as \add appeareth\add* this day.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto me, Behold , I have begun to give Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess , that thou mayest inherit his land.
Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people , to fight at Jahaz.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God delivered him before us; and we smote him, and his sons , and all his people.

And we took all his cities at that time , and utterly destroyed the men , and the women , and the little ones , of every city , we left none to remain :\f + \fr 2.34 \ft the men…: Heb. every city of men, and women, and little ones\f*
Only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the spoil of the cities which we took.

From Aroer , which \add is\add* by the brink of the river of Arnon , and \add from\add* the city that \add is\add* by the river , even unto Gilead , there was not one city too strong for us: the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God delivered all unto us :

Only unto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not, \add nor\add* unto any place of the river Jabbok , nor unto the cities in the mountains , nor unto whatsoever the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God forbad us.
